thread.title: Amazon River and rainforest topic at next meeting
thread.title_full: Amazon River and rainforest topic at next meeting

title: Amazon River and rainforest topic at next meeting
text: Amazon River and rainforest topic at next meeting Comment Posted Sep. 4, 2015 at 8:16 PM Posted Sep. 4, 2015 at 8:16 PM » Social News I used to worry that all the trees in the jungle would be cut down to make paper for their reports on how to save the rain forest! — Nick Birch In a Seniors With Inquiring Minds (SWIM) presentation, on Friday at 1 p.m. at Trinity Lutheran Church, 16138 Molino Dr, Victorville, Leah McEntee will tell about “The Amazon River and It’s Rain Forest” . McEntee will share a powerpoint presentation about the history of the river and it many tributaries, plants and animals. She was on an Amazon River Boat trip several months ago and met the river and it's people up close and personal. The city of Iquitos in Peru, which is the largest city in the world to be inaccessible by a road, was her jumping off place for this trip down the river. During the high water Iquitos becomes a Venice in the Rain Forest. She will share her trip, her insights and thoughts about the rain forest today and it’s future. McEntee, a member SWIM, loves to travel to exotic places and then return home to share her journey. SWIM meets weekly at Trinity Lutheran Church, 16138 Molino Dr, Victorville. Guests are always welcome. Snacks and coffee are provided as well as time to share with friends. For more information, contact Leah at 760-956 7581 or Ruth at 760-247 9003.
